metadata.title: CVE-2022-37290 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
GNOME Nautilus 42.2 allows a NULL pointer dereference and get_basenameapplication crash via a pasted ZIP archive.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-37290` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-nautilus-3.0 - 1:42.2-0ubuntu2.1
libnautilus-extension1a - 1:42.2-0ubuntu2.1
nautilus - 1:42.2-0ubuntu2.1
nautilus-data - 1:42.2-0ubuntu2.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: nautilus package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:42.2-0ubuntu2.1').
nemo package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
caja package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
